intro: Phthirusa ptariana, commonly known as the creeping phthirusa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with slender stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale in color, arranged in umbels. Phthirusa ptariana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along streambanks.
